note1: sự nhất trí, sự đồng lòng
note: an opinion that all members of a group agree with
example: There is broad consensus ( of opinion) in the country on this issue.

note1: sự đồng ý, sự ưng thuận, sự cho phép
note: permission to do something, especially given by somebody in authority
example: The written consent of a parent is required.

note: to protect something and prevent it from being changed or destroyed
example: New laws are to conserve wildlife in the area.

note1: tính nhất quán, tính kiên định, tính trước sau như một
note: the quality of always behaving in the same way or of having the same opinions, standard, etc.; the quality of being consistent
example: She has played with great consistency all season.

note: to make a position of power or success stronger so that it is more likely to continue
example: The president is trying to consolidate support for his proposal.

note1: các cử tri, những người đi bỏ phiếu (của một khu vực bầu cử)
note: the people who live in and vote in a particular district
example: In this election, the constituency fell to Labour.

note: the system of laws and basic principles that a state, a country or an organization is governed by
example: Can the Constitution be changed?

note: connected with the constitution of a country or an organization
example: England is a constitutional monarchy.

note: a thing that limits something, or limits your freedom to do something
example: The government has placed tight constraints on spending this year.

note: a meeting with an expert, especially a doctor, to get advice or treatment
example: A 30-minute consultation will cost £50.

note: to look at somebody/something in a careful way for a long time
example: She contemplated him in silence.

note1: sự coi khinh, sự coi thường, sự khinh bỉ
note: the feeling that somebody/something is without value and deserves no respect at all
example: Contempt of fame begets contempt of virtue.

note1: chiến đấu, đấu tranh; đua tranh
note: to compete against somebody in order to gain something
example: They will have to contend with a determined opposition.

note: a person or team with a chance of winning a competition
example: China is considered a “key contender” that could compete directly with India.

note1: [một cách] liên tục, [một cách] không ngớt
note: in a way that is repeated many times so that it is annoying
example: They argue continually about money.

note1: sự mâu thuẫn, sự trái ngược
note: a lack of agreement between facts, opinions, actions, etc.
example: There is a contradiction between the two sets of figures.

note1: người cộng tác (với một tờ báo); công tác viên
note: a person who writes articles for a magazine, book or website, or who talks on a radio or television programme or at a meeting
example: I am a contributor to several blogs.

note: the act or process of changing something from one form, use or system to another
example: Their main business is the conversion of farm buildings into family homes.

note1: sự kết án, sự kết tội
note: the act of finding somebody guilty of a crime in court; the fact of having been found guilty
example: He has a conviction for dangerous driving.

note: to work together with somebody else in order to achieve something
example: The two groups agreed to cooperate with each other.

note: involving doing something together or working together with others towards a shared aim
example: My company always appreciate the cooperative spirit.

note1: điều phối, phối hợp, sắp xếp
note: to organize the different parts of an activity and the people involved in it so that it works well
example: They appointed a new manager to coordinate the work of the team.

note1: sự phối hợp, sự phối trí
note: the act of making parts of something, groups of people, etc. work together in an efficient and organized way
example: The aim was to improve the coordination of services.

note: a person who organizes the different parts of an activity and the people involved in it so that it works well
example: The campaign needs an effective coordinator.

note1: sự sửa;  sự sửa chữa, sự hiệu chỉnh
note: a change that makes something more accurate than it was before
example: I've made a few small corrections to your report.

note1: có tương quan với nhau, có liên quan, liên hệ
note: if two or more facts, figures, etc. correlate or if a fact, figure, etc. correlates with another, the facts are closely connected and affect or depend on each other
example: The figures do not seem to correlate.

note: a connection between two things in which one thing changes as the other does
example: There is a direct correlation between exposure to sun and skin cancer.

note1: thư từ; quan hệ thư từ
note: the letters, emails, etc. a person sends and receives
example: The department intercepted the correspondence of foreign diplomats.

note1: thông tín viên (của một tờ báo, một đài phát thanh…), phóng viên (báo chí)
note: a person who reports news from a particular country or on a particular subject for a newspaper or a television or radio station
example: She's the BBC's political correspondent.

note: matching or connected with something that you have just mentioned
example: A change in the money supply brings a corresponding change in expenditure.

note1: nhận của đút lót; ăn hối lộ; tham nhũng
note: willing to use their power to do dishonest or illegal things in return for money or to get an advantage
example: Corrupt officials who won't issue permits unless you bribe them.

note1: sự hối lộ, sự tham nhũng,
note: dishonest or illegal behaviour, especially of people in authority
example: This police unit was established to fight corruption.

note1: lời hướng dẫn, khuyến cáo, tư vấn
note: professional advice about a problem
example: It is generally accepted that the bereaved benefit from counselling.

note1: nhân viên tư vấn, cố vấn, tham mưu
note: a person who has been trained to advise people with problems, especially personal problems
example: Peter's mother is an insurance counsellor.

note: a long flat surface over which goods are sold or business is done in a shop, bank, etc.
example: I asked the woman behind the counter if they had any postcards.

note1: bên tương ứng, người đồng nhiệm; người đồng cấp
note: a person or thing that has the same position or function as somebody/something else in a different place or situation
example: The prime minister is meeting his Italian counterpart.

note1: sự tin cậy; sự tín nhiệm
note: the quality that somebody/something has that makes people believe or trust them
example: Credibility is trust plus expertise.

note1: sự phê bình, nghệ thuật phê bình
note: a piece of written criticism of a set of ideas, a work of art, etc.
example: She wrote a feminist critique of Freud's theories.

note: an object in the shape of a circle, usually made of gold and precious stones, that a king or queen wears on his or her head on official occasions
example: At the coronation, the archbishop put a crown on the Queen's head.

note: a small piece of a substance with many even sides, that is formed naturally when the substance becomes solid
example: Diamond is a carbon crystal.

note: to prepare and use land for growing plants or crops
example: They tried to cultivate wet rice.

note1: sự ham biết; sự tò mò; tính hiếu kỳ
note: a strong desire to know about something
example: Children show curiosity about everything.

note1: sự trông nom, sự chăm sóc, sự giám hộ
note: the legal right or duty to take care of or keep somebody/something; the act of taking care of something/somebody
example: The parents were given joint custody of the two children.

note: a piece cut off a plant that will be used to grow a new plant
example: Propagate plants from seeds and cuttings.

note: a barrier that is built across a river in order to stop the water from flowing, used especially to make a reservoir (= a lake for storing water) or to produce electricity
example: They 're building a hydroelectric dam.

note1: mảnh vỡ, mảnh vụn; đống đổ nát
note: pieces of wood, metal, building materials, etc. that are left after something has been destroyed
example: After the crash, debris from the plane was scattered over a large area.

note1: buổi ra mắt đầu tiên trước công chúng
note: the first public appearance of a performer or sports player
example: Cooper made his debut at Covent Garden in 1989.

note1: [noncount] :the act or process of deciding something especially with a group of people
note: the process of deciding about something important, especially in a group of people or in an organization
example: responsibility for decision-making

note1: sự tuyên bố; lời tuyên bố, bản tuyên ngôn
note: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement
example: Declaration of Independence

note1: sự cống hiến, sự hiến dâng; sự tận tụy
note: the hard work and effort that somebody puts into an activity or a purpose because they think it is important
example: His dedication to the company is great.

note1: (pháp lý) không trả nợ được, vỡ nợ
note: to fail to do something that you legally have to do, especially by not paying a debt
example: If you default on your mortgage, the bank can take your house.

note1: thiếu sót, sai sót; khuyết điểm
note: a fault in something or in the way it has been made that means that it is not perfect
example: The book contains serious defects.

note1: để bảo vệ, để phòng thủ
note: protecting somebody/something against attack
example: Our troops battered down the enemy's defensive works.

note: the state of not having, or not having enough of, something that is essential
example: Vitamin deficiency in the diet can cause illness.

note1: số tiền thiếu hụt (do chi lớn hơn thu); thậm hụt
note: the amount by which money spent or owed is greater than money earned in a particular period of time
example: Many countries have a big deficit in food supply.

note1: người đại biểu, người đại diện
note: a person who is chosen or elected to represent the views of a group of people and vote and make decisions for them
example: Congress delegates rejected the proposals.

note: a group of people who represent the views of an organization, a country, etc.
example: US high ranking delegation will visit our country next month.

note: a statement that something is not true or does not exist; the action of denying something
example: Denial usually makes everything worse than ever.

note1: lên án; phản đối kịch liệt; lăng mạ
note: to strongly criticize somebody/something that you think is wrong, illegal, etc.
example: She publicly denounced the government's handling of the crisis.

note: the quality of being dense; the degree to which something is dense
example: The population density in this city is very high.

note1: sự phụ thuộc, sự dựa vào
note: the state of needing the help and support of somebody/something in order to survive or be successful
example: Our relationship was based on mutual dependence.

note1: dàn (quân), dàn thành thế trận, triển khai
note: to move soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action
example: The British Army will soon deploy new heavy recovery vehicles.

note1: (quân sự) sự dàn quân, sự triển khai
note: the act of moving soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action
example: This Treaty places upper limits to the deployment of conventional armed forces in Europe.

note: a sum of money that is given as the first part of a larger payment
example: They normally ask you to pay $100 (as a) deposit.

note1: người được ủy quyền, người thay quyền, đại diện; phó
note: a person who is the next most important person below a business manager, a head of a school, a political leader, etc. and who does the person’s job when he or she is away
example: I'm acting as deputy till the headmaster returns.

note1: đáng thèm muốn, đáng khát khao, đáng mong muốn
note: that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing
example: Transgenic plants have been engineered to possess several desirable traits.

note1: phá hủy, tàn phá, hủy diệt
note: causing destruction or damage
example: The war demonstrated the destructive power of modern weapons.

note1: giam giữ (ai) lại, cầm chân (ai) lại
note: to keep somebody in an official place, such as a police station, a prison or a hospital, and prevent them from leaving
example: One man has been detained for questioning.

note1: sự phát hiện, sự khám phá
note: the process of discovering or noticing something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.; the fact of being discovered or noticed
example: He tries to avoid detection by disguising.

note: the state of being kept in a place, especially a prison, and prevented from leaving
example: They were sentenced to 12 months' detention in a young offender institution.

note1: nghĩ ra, đặt ra (kế hoạch…); sáng chế, phát minh
note: to invent something new or a new way of doing something
example: A new system has been devised to control traffic in the city.

note: to say exactly what an illness or the cause of a problem is
example: The test is used to diagnose a variety of diseases.

note1: sự chẩn đoán; lời chẩn đoán
note: the act of discovering or identifying the exact cause of an illness or a problem
example: His doctor made a diagnosis of appendicitis.

note: to tell somebody what to do, especially in an annoying way
example: You can't dictate to people how they should live.

note1: kẻ độc tài, người có quyền hành tuyệt đối (ở một lĩnh vực nào)
note: a political leader who has complete power over a country, especially one who has gained it using military force
example: Hitler is a fascist dictator.

note: to recognize or show that two things are not the same
example: It's difficult to differentiate between the two varieties.

note1: thế tiến thoái lưỡng nan, tình trạng khó xử
note: a situation that makes problems, often one in which you have to make a very difficult choice between things of equal importance
example: Parents are often placed in dilemma.

note: a measurement in space, for example how high, wide or long something is
example: We measured the dimensions of the kitchen.

note1: [làm] bớt, [làm] giảm bớt, thu nhỏ, cạn kiệt
note: to become smaller, weaker, etc.; to make something become smaller, weaker, etc.
example: The world's resources are rapidly diminishing.

note: a person whose job is to represent his or her country in a foreign country, for example, in an embassy
example: He is the second American diplomat to be expelled from Ecuador this month.

note1: danh bạ, danh mục, thư mục
note: a book or electronic resource containing lists of information, usually in alphabetical order, for example people’s phone numbers or the names and addresses of businesses in a particular area
example: Sub directory is not the root directory.

note1: bỏ, loại bỏ, vứt bỏ (quần áo, thói quen, lòng tin…)
note: to get rid of something that you no longer want or need
example: The room was littered with discarded newspapers.

note: to give somebody official permission to leave the police or the armed forces; to make somebody leave the police or the armed forces
example: He was discharged from the army following his injury.

note: to give somebody information about something, especially something that was previously secret
example: The spokesman refused to disclose details of the takeover to the press.

note1: sự tiết lộ, sự vạch trần, sự phơi bày
note: the act of making something known or public that was previously secret or private
example: The court ruled to prevent public disclosure of the contents of the documents.

note1: bài nghị luận; bài thuyết trình, bài diễn thuyết
note: a long and serious treatment or discussion of a subject in speech or writing
example: There is a discourse on 19th century British novels at the university this Sunday.

note1: sự tự do làm theo ý mình
note: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation
example: Don't keep asking me what to do, use your own discretion.

note1: sự kỳ thị; sự phân biệt đối xử
note: the practice of treating somebody or a particular group in society less fairly than others
example: Friendship has no sex discrimination.

note1: sự sa thải, sự thải hồi
note: the act of dismissing somebody from their job; an example of this
example: He sued his employer for wrongful dismissal.

note: to take the place of somebody/something
example: Gradually factory workers have been displaced by machines.

note: to arrange things or people in a particular way or position
example: The visitors disposed themselves in a circle round the statue.

note1: sự tranh cãi; cuộc tranh cãi
note: an argument between two people, groups or countries; discussion about a subject on which people disagree
example: There has been much dispute over the question of legalized abortion.

note1: sự đập gãy, sự phá vỡ; sự gãy vỡ, sự gián đoạn
note: a situation in which it is difficult for something to continue in the normal way; the act of stopping something from continuing in the normal way
example: The strike has caused serious disruption of the production schedule.

note1: sự phân biệt; điểm phân biệt, sự khác biệt
note: the act of separating people or things into different groups
example: Philosophers did not use to make a distinction between arts and science.

note: having a quality or characteristic that makes something different and easily noticed
example: The Amish have very distinctive customs.

note1: vặn vẹo, bóp méo, làm méo mó
note: to change the shape, appearance or sound of something so that it is strange or not clear
example: The loudspeaker seemed to distort his voice.

note1: nỗi đau buồn, nỗi đau khổ
note: a feeling of great worry or unhappiness; great mental pain
example: Her death was a great distress to all the family.

note: a belief or set of beliefs held and taught by a Church, a political party, etc.
example: Muslims thus follow an authoritarian doctrine.

note1: sự chứng minh bằng tư liệu, tài liệu chứng minh
note: the documents that are required for something, or that give evidence or proof of something
example: Do you have any documentation of this problem?

note: an area of knowledge or activity; especially one that somebody is responsible for
example: Financial matters are her domain.

note: the fact of being more important, powerful or easy to notice than somebody/something else
example: He asserted his dominance over the other party members.

note1: người cho, người tặng, người quyên cho, nhà tài trợ
note: a person or an organization that makes a gift of money, clothes, food, etc. to a charity, etc.
example: She is one of the charity's main donors.

note1: chết đuối; làm chết đuối, dìm chết
note: to die because you have been underwater too long and you cannot breathe; to kill somebody by holding them underwater
example: Two children drowned after falling into the river.

note1: phong cho cái tên; gán cho cái tên, đặt cho cái tên
note: to give somebody/something a particular name, often in a humorous or critical way
example: The media dubbed anorexia ‘the slimming disease’.

note1: đôi biểu diễn, cặp biểu diễn, bộ đôi
note: two people who perform together or are often seen or thought of together
example: The most famous comedy duo in cinema history.

note1: ham, háo hức, hăm hở, thiết tha
note: very interested and excited by something that is going to happen or about something that you want to do; showing this
example: We were eager for news.

note: if a sound echoes, it is reflected off a wall, the side of a mountain, etc. so that you can hear it again
example: Her footsteps echoed in the empty room.

note: connected with the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their environment
example: We're studying about worldwide ecological changes.

note: the fact of producing the result that is wanted or intended; the fact of producing a successful result
example: The effectiveness of this new medicine has been proven in clinical trials.

note1: hiệu suất; hiệu quả, hiệu lực; sản lượng
note: the quality of doing something well with no waste of time or money
example: The new computer system will cut costs and increase efficiency.

note: your sense of your own value and importance
example: Arrogance is ego plus ignorance.

note1: phức tạp, tỉ mỉ, công phu; chi tiết; trau chuốt
note: very complicated and detailed; carefully prepared and organized
example: She had prepared a very elaborate meal.

note: to give somebody/something a higher position or rank, often more important than they deserve
example: He elevated many of his friends to powerful positions within the government.

note1: đủ tư cách, thích hợp, đủ điều kiện
note: a person who is eligible for something or to do something, is able to have or do it because they have the right qualifications, are the right age, etc.
example: Only those over 70 are eligible for the special payment.

note1: thành phần tinh túy, ưu tú, cao cấp
note: belonging to a group of people in society that is small in number but powerful and with a lot of influence, because they are rich, intelligent, etc.
example: They're an elite squad.

note: to get onto a ship or plane; to put somebody/something onto a ship or plane
example: We stood on the pier and watched as they embarked.

note1: sự [làm] lúng túng, sự [làm] bối rối
note: shy, uncomfortable or guilty feelings; a feeling of being embarrassed
example: She usually crimsons with embarrassment.

note1: sự nổi lên, sự hiện ra, sự lòi ra
note: the fact of somebody/something moving out of or away from something and becoming possible to see
example: Two significant factors contributed to the emergence of women's history.

note1: theo lối kinh nghiệm, do kinh nghiệm
note: based on experiments or experience rather than ideas or theories
example: The accepted wisdom is that mathematics lacks empirical content.

note1: cho quyền, cho phép, trao quyền
note: to give somebody the power or authority to do something
example: The courts were empowered to impose the death sentence for certain crimes.

note1: sự khuyến khích, sự khích lệ, sự cổ vũ, sự động viên
note: the act of encouraging somebody to do something; something that encourages somebody
example: Thanks for your lately encouragement.

note1: khuyến khích, cổ vũ, khích lệ, động viên
note: that gives somebody support, courage or hope
example: This month's unemployment figures are not very encouraging.

note1: sự cố gắng, sự nỗ lực
note: an attempt to do something, especially something new or difficult
example: The elimination of all nuclear weapons must be a global endeavour involving all states.

note: to say publicly that you support a person, statement or course of action
example: I wholeheartedly endorse his remarks.

note1: sự xác nhận; sự tán thành, sự chứng thực
note: a public statement or action showing that you support somebody/something
example: Advertising or a life-empowering endorsement by Oprah had nothing to do with it.

note: to experience and deal with something that is painful or unpleasant without giving up
example: He can endure it no longer.

note1: sự đính hôn, sự hứa hôn
note: an agreement to marry somebody; the period during which two people are engaged
example: Their engagement was announced in the local paper.

note1: lôi cuốn, hấp dẫn; duyên dáng
note: interesting or pleasant in a way that attracts your attention
example: She has an engaging smile.

note: to ask somebody for some information
example: I called the station to enquire about train times.

note: to improve the quality of something, often by adding something to it
example: To enrich your vocabulary, you can read news in English.

note1: ghi tên [cho] vào, kết nạp vào; đăng kí nhập học
note: to arrange for yourself or for somebody else to officially join a course, school, etc.
example: You need to enrol before the end of August.

note1: công ty kinh doanh, hãng, doanh nghiệp
note: a company or business
example: He is in charge of an enterprise with a turnover of $26 billion.

note1: người nhiệt tình, người say mê
note: a person who is very interested in something and spends a lot of time doing it
example: Mary is a music enthusiast.

note: to give somebody the right to have or to do something
example: Nothing can entitle you to ask such personal questions.

note1: thực thể, cơ quan, bộ phận
note: something that exists separately from other things and has its own identity
example: What entity predetermines fate or destiny?

note: a large number of cases of a particular disease or medical condition happening at the same time in a particular community
example: He died in a typhoid epidemic.

note1: sự bằng nhau, sự ngang nhau; sự bình đẳng
note: the fact of being equal in rights, status, advantages, etc.
example: I believe in equality of the sexes.

note: a statement showing that two amounts or values are equal, for example 2x + y = 54
example: What is trinomial equation?

note: to become greater, worse, more serious, etc.; to make something greater, worse, more serious, etc.
example: Any one of these border disputes could escalate into war

note1: tổ chức (quân đội, hải quân, hành chính...); cơ sở (kinh doanh)
note: an organization, a large institution or a hotel
example: She's now running a small government research establishment.

note1: (thuộc) sự tiến hoá; sự tiến triển
note: connected with evolution; connected with slow steady development and change
example: Bạn có thể tìm thấy các quá trình tiến hóa trong quyển sách này.

note: to make something seem larger, better, worse or more important than it really is
example: He should not exaggerate the importance of this agreement.

note1: sự loại trừ, sự đuổi ra, sự tống ra, sự ngăn chặn
note: the act of preventing somebody/something from entering a place or taking part in something
example: He was disappointed with his exclusion from the England squad.

note: only to be used by one particular person or group; only given to one particular person or group
example: The hotel has exclusive access to the beach.

note: for only one particular person, group or use
example: Products are distributed exclusively.

note1: sự hành hình, sự thi hành án tử hình
note: the act of killing somebody, especially as a legal punishment
example: He faced execution by hanging for murder.

note1: dùng, sử dụng; áp dụng (sức mạnh, ảnh hưởng…)
note: to use power or influence to affect somebody/something
example: He exerted all his authority to make them accept the plan.

note1: sự đi đày, sự lưu đày
note: the state of being sent to live in another country that is not your own, especially for political reasons or as a punishment
example: Exile was for him a living death.

note1: sự tiêu dùng, chi tiêu, phí tổn
note: the act of spending or using money; an amount of money spent
example: The budget provided for a total expenditure of £27 billion.

note1: dựa trên thí nghiệm; để thí nghiệm
note: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have
example: Those experimental evidences support this conclusion.

note1: kết thúc; hết hiệu lực, hết hạn
note: to be no longer legally acceptable because the period of time for which it could be used has ended
example: When does your driving licence expire?

note1: rõ ràng; rành mạch, dứt khoát
